aboutme.title: About me
aboutme.p1: My name is Felipe Scherer, creator of Fennec Tales Studio and a software developer with over 5 years of experience delivering innovative solutions across various platforms. My expertise ranges from web to mobile development, with a strong emphasis on user experience and performance.
aboutme.p2: Currently, I'm expanding my skills in game development. Committed to continuous learning, I stay up to date with industry trends to ensure the highest quality results.

resume.title: Resume
resume.p1: With over 5 years of experience in software development, I hold a degree in Computer Science and several certifications from tech courses. Currently, I am pursuing a postgraduate specialization in algorithms.

blog.title: Blog
blog.description: Sometimes I like to create articles about what I learned or just to share what I am thinking. Feel free to check it out üòÅ. And of course, you can leave suggestions for next blogs in

aboutme.title: About me
aboutme.text1: I am Felipe Scherer, creator of Fennec Tales Studio and a software developer with over five years of experience in delivering innovative solutions across various platforms. My expertise spans web and mobile application development, with a strong emphasis on user experience and performance.
aboutme.text2: Currently, I am expanding my skills in game development. Committed to continuous learning, I stay updated with industry trends to ensure the highest quality results.

By clicking on the download button, you'll gain access to a detailed document that highlights my educational background, work history, key achievements, and areas of expertise. Whether you're a potential employer, collaborator, or simply curious about my career trajectory, my CV/resume offers valuable insights.

seo.defaultDescription: Here you can find all my projects

alura-courses.title: Alura Courses
alura-courses.description: This repository showcases projects completed during my Alura subscription, covering programming, web development, management, and design. These courses provided hands-on experience in frontend and backend development, UX/UI design, and social media strategies, contributing to a well-rounded skill set.

rocketseat-bootcamp.title: Bootcamp Rocketseat
rocketseat-bootcamp.description: This repository features projects developed during the Rocketseat bootcamp, covering web, mobile, and backend development. The bootcamp provided in-depth training on modern technologies such as React, React Native, and Node.js.

rocketseat-challenge-01-todo-list.title: Challenge 01 - Todo List Rocketseat
rocketseat-challenge-01-todo-list.description: This repository contains the implementation of Challenge 01: Todo List from Rocketseat's Ignite bootcamp. The project focuses on task management with features like adding, completing, and deleting tasks. It reinforces core React concepts such as state management and component structure.

rocketseat-challenge-02-coffee-delivery.title: Challenge 02 - Coffee Delivery Rocketseat
rocketseat-challenge-02-coffee-delivery.description: This project, part of Rocketseat's Ignite bootcamp, focuses on building an online coffee ordering system using React. It explores React hooks, contexts, and reducers, enhancing understanding of state management and component interactions.

alura-animal-quiz.title: Animal Quiz
alura-animal-quiz.description: Developed during Alura's Intensive Week React, this quiz tests knowledge about animals using Next.js. The project introduced me to React and JSON handling, making it a key learning experience. Inspired by my adopted kitten, Luna, it also fosters community by featuring other participants' quizzes.

alura-game-dev.title: Game Dev
alura-game-dev.description: This repository contains a runner game developed during Alura's Intensive Game Dev Week. My first GitHub project, it introduced me to JavaScript via the P5.js library and sparked my interest in programming and game development.

dev-superior-fsdelivery-sds2.title: FS Delivery
dev-superior-fsdelivery-sds2.description: FS Delivery is a full-stack project simulating a meal delivery system, developed during DevSuperior‚Äôs event. It integrates a Java Spring backend with React and React Native frontends, enabling order placement, address configuration, and delivery management via a mobile app.

rocketseat-nlw-04.title: Move it
rocketseat-nlw-04.description: Move It is a Pomodoro-based RPG-style productivity app developed during Rocketseat‚Äôs NLW 04. It gamifies work intervals with exercise challenges and rewards users with points for leveling up, making productivity engaging and interactive.

rocketseat-nlw-05.title: Plant Manager
rocketseat-nlw-05.description: Plant Manager is a mobile app developed during Rocketseat's NLW 05, my first React Native project. It allows users to register plants and receive reminders for care tasks like watering and sunlight exposure. The app incorporates a gamification system where users earn points for completing tasks, enhancing engagement.

rocketseat-nlw-06.title: Let me Ask
rocketseat-nlw-06.description: Developed during Rocketseat's NLW 06, this live Q&A app enables streamers to create rooms where viewers submit and vote on questions. It was my first experience with Firebase for authentication and database management, making it a valuable learning opportunity.

rocketseat-nlw-setup-habits.title: Habits
rocketseat-nlw-setup-habits.description: Habit Manager, created during Rocketseat's NLW Setup, helps users track habits and set completion goals. The project strengthened my backend development skills while maintaining a consistent frontend across web and mobile platforms.

college-algorithm-best-fit.title: Best Fit Algorithm
college-algorithm-best-fit.description: This college project simulates the Best Fit memory allocation algorithm. It demonstrates how processes are allocated to the smallest available memory blocks and handles scenarios like memory overflow. The program runs with a fixed set of 100 memory elements, simulating real-world allocation.

college-aps-1.title: APS 1 | Save the Green
college-aps-1.description: Save the Green is my first college project, a simple HTML and CSS website about environmental NGOs and waste collection points. Created before I learned GitHub, it represents my early programming journey, and I hope to revisit it with updated skills.

college-aps-2.title: APS 2 | Eco Pontos
college-aps-2.description: Eco Points Locator, developed in my second semester, calculates the closest waste disposal site using Python. It employs a pathfinding algorithm and runs in the console, allowing users to input coordinates and find the nearest Eco Point.

college-aps-3.title: APS 3 | Academic System
college-aps-3.description: University Management System, built in Java during my third semester, manages student records, courses, and grades. Using object-oriented programming, it operates in the console and stores data in CSV files, simulating a basic database.

college-aps-4.title: APS 4 | Library System
college-aps-4.description: A Library Management System developed for my Computer Science course's fourth-semester APS (Supervised Practical Activities). The project focused on databases, using MySQL (my first experience with a DB language) and Java Swing/AWT for the GUI. It follows the MVC pattern and allows managing a bookstore's authors, books, and publishers (CRUD operations) via a MySQL-backed Java interface.

college-aps-5.title: APS 5 Networks | Chat
college-aps-5.description: A Chat Simulator built for my fifth-semester APS, focusing on computer networks. The project uses sockets (key network communication points) to enable real-time messaging. Developed with React and Socket.io, it features a minimalist frontend and supports emoji messages, simulating a basic live chat experience.

college-aps-6.title: APS 6 | Restaurant management system
college-aps-6.description: A Linux-based Restaurant Management System simulating backup redundancy across three VMs (Cashier, Server, Administrator) for my sixth-semester APS. The Cashier VM generates random orders (12 pm‚Äì3 pm), triggering daily backups to the Server. Reports are generated post-backup, with firewalls/proxies restricting VM communication per role (e.g., Cashier can‚Äôt contact Administrator directly).

college-aps-7.title: APS 7 | Class diagram
college-aps-7.description: A Software Engineering project (seventh-semester APS) focused on system planning. Involved creating UML diagrams (class diagrams, use cases) and documentation for a theoretical computational system, emphasizing design principles over implementation.

college-aps-8.title: APS 8 | Redundancy system
college-aps-8.description: A distributed systems project (eighth-semester APS) demonstrating server redundancy. Used HaProxy (Load Balancer), Docker, and FastAPI to ensure system uptime if a server fails. K6 tested the API's resilience.

college-atm-simulation.title: ATM simulation
college-atm-simulation.description: A Python script simulating ATM queues/stacks for Data Structures class. Generates random customer arrivals, adjustable queue lengths, and a daily activity report.

college-computer-science-final-paper.title: TCC | J√° vi
college-computer-science-final-paper.description: A movie/series management app (my Computer Science Final Paper) inspired by MyAnimeList. Developed by a team of 5, it lets users track and review media. Built with Firebase (auth/database) and focused on accessibility (keyboard navigation, contrast, responsiveness).

college-data-structures.title: Data Structure Algorithms
college-data-structures.description: A repository of data structure implementations: infix-to-postfix conversion, equation solver, recursive exponentiation, Tower of Hanoi, and 5 sorting algorithms (Bubble, Selection, Insertion, Quick, Comb). Each includes problem statements and solutions.

college-ellipse-transformation.title: Geometry
college-ellipse-transformation.description: A Computer Graphics project demonstrating geometric transformations (rotation, translation, scaling, shearing) on ellipses. Users can adjust vertices and apply real-time modifications to study shape behavior.

college-image-thresholding.title: Image Thresholding
college-image-thresholding.description: A Python script for image thresholding (converting images to binary black/white). Developed in an Image Processing class, it calculates pixel cutoff values using mathematical methods to determine optimal binarization.

college-lights-out.title: Lights Out
college-lights-out.description: An AI class project simulating the Lights Out puzzle. Uses state-space search to solve a matrix (0s/1s) where clicking a cell toggles it and adjacent cells, aiming to turn all values to 0.

college-linear-systeam-solver.title: Resolution of linear systems
college-linear-systeam-solver.description: A Numerical Calculus project: Python algorithm to solve linear systems of any size. Focused on scalability, numerical stability (handling ill-conditioned matrices), and efficiency for engineering/data science applications.

pokedex.title: Pokedex
pokedex.description: A React/NextJS Pok√©mon encyclopedia using a free API. Features Pok√©mon listings with animations, plus detailed info on types, stats, evolutions, and locations. Designed in Figma to practice both API integration and UI skills.

portifolio-v2.title: Portfolio
portifolio-v2.description: My v2.0 developer portfolio built with NextJS 13 (App Router) and Tailwind CSS. Focuses on clean, maintainable code with i18n support and modular theming to showcase projects accessibly for both technical and non-technical audiences.

rpg.title: WHITN V1 RPG Token
rpg.description: An Angular-based RPG character sheet for WHITN (a custom Cthulhu-inspired system). Created to streamline gameplay with auto-calculated attributes, player/NPC management, and image uploads. Developed during my internship to practice Angular.

rpg-v2.title: Angular RPG V2
rpg-v2.description: Simplified v2 of my WHITN RPG system (based on Trail of Cthulhu). Improved with mobile support, dark mode, and streamlined mechanics to focus on narrative. Built with Angular leveraging experience from v1.

morse-secret-scripter.title: Morse Secret Encoder/Decoder
morse-secret-scripter.description: A simple Morse code translator tool. Encodes Latin text to Morse (dots/dashes) and decodes Morse back to text, with a built-in Morse dictionary reference.

fennec-tales-blog.title: Fennec Tales Blog
fennec-tales-blog.description: Fennec Tales Blog is where I share coding insights, patterns, and best practices I've learned as a developer. From debugging tips to design strategies, it's all about improving skills. Beyond tech, I explore life goals and personal projects, reflecting on growth and challenges. A space for learning, passion, and progress! üöÄ

readme-generator.title: Readme Generator
readme-generator.description: GitHub README Generator helps keep all my projects well-organized with consistent, well-formatted README files. With extensive configuration options, it adapts to any project type, ensuring clarity and professionalism. No more messy READMEs‚Äîjust clean, structured documentation every time!

game-off-2023.title: Game Off 2023
game-off-2023.description: Tower Defense Game created for Game Off 2023, hosted by GitHub. Built with the Godot engine, this project marks my first dive into a major game engine. It blends strategic gameplay with engaging mechanics, showcasing my journey into game development. A challenging and rewarding experience!

services.title: Services Landing Page
services.description: Simple Services Landing Page built to practice layout design and measure how quickly I could create a clean, functional page. Focused on responsiveness, simplicity, and efficiency, this project helped refine my front-end skills while exploring effective UI/UX principles

game-off-2024.title: Game Off 2024
game-off-2024.description: The 2024 edition of Game Off featured the theme SECRETS, challenging participants to create a game incorporating this concept. I developed a clicker game where players must uncover the correct potion recipe to fulfill each client's request.

restaurant-menu.title: Restaurant Menu
restaurant-menu.description: This project involves designing a simple, user-friendly local restaurant menu. It organizes items clearly, highlighting key information like prices. The goal is to enhance the eating experience by providing an intuitive and easy-to-read menu.

project.notExist: The project type does not exist

fennec-tales.title: Fennec Tales Studio
fennec-tales.text: Fennec Tales Studio is a project about sharing knowledge and creativity. Our blog features monthly articles, offering insights on tech, game design and professional experiences. On our YouTube channel, you can dive into weekly videos that explore these topics in greater depth. Additionally, we showcase carousel images on LinkedIn and Instagram, providing quick tips content to keep you inspired. We invite you to explore our work, engage with our content and share your thoughts!

currently.title: I am currently
currently.item1: Working as web developer, using React and NextJS.
currently.item2: Going regularly to gym and running on weekends.
currently.item3: Writing myblog and creating videos for Fennec Tales Studio.
currently.item4: Studying drawing, animation and game development.

footer.title: Contact
footer.text2: Have a question or incredible project idea in mind? Reach out through the form or the email below, and I will get back to you within 48 hours. Let's connect and create something great together!

form.toast-sucess: Message sent. Thank you. I will reply soon as possible üòä
form.toast-error: Please, fill all fields before submitting

web.title: Web development
web.text: I build custom websites like restaurant menus, online stores, and more using WordPress or React & Next.js. Fast, responsive and tailored to your needs.

design.title: Company design identity
design.text: I create unique brand identities, including logos, color schemes and typography, to help your business stand out. Let's design a cohesive look that reflects your company's values and vision.

ai.title: Image restoration using AI
ai.text: I offer AI-powered image restoration services to bring your old or damaged photos back to life. Experience enhanced clarity and detail while preserving the original essence of your cherished memories.

editing.title: Video Editing
editing.text: I provide professional video editing services to transform your raw footage into polished, engaging content. From cuts and transitions to color correction and sound design, I'll help bring your vision to life.

organized.title: Organized
organized.text: Being organized allows me to manage multiple projects efficiently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. It helps me maintain careful and ensure quality in every detail of my work.

problem-solving.title: Problem Solving
problem-solving.text: Through my experience, I have learned to tackle challenges like debugging code, optimizing performance, and designing efficient systems. Strong problem-solving skills are essential for navigating these obstacles successfully.

collaboration.title: Collaboration
collaboration.text: I thrive in team environments, valuing diverse perspectives and open communication. I work seamlessly with developers, designers, and stakeholders, contributing effectively to Agile or Scrum projects and fostering a positive, productive dynamic.

adaptability.title: Adaptability & Continuous Learning
adaptability.text: I stay up in the ever-evolving tech landscape, quickly adapting to new tools, languages, and frameworks. Committed to continuous learning, I embrace interesting trends to keep my skills sharp and relevant.

attention.title: Attention to Detail
attention.text: I bring precision to coding, recognizing that even minor errors can lead to major problems. My keen attention to detail ensures accuracy in writing, debugging, and reviewing code for a great work.

creativity.title: Creativity
creativity.text: I excel at thinking outside the box to develop innovative solutions, design intuitive and user-friendly interfaces. Creativity drives my work in UX/UI design, game development, and crafting engaging digital experiences.

empathy.title: Empathy
empathy.text: I prioritize understanding user needs and pain points, which enables me to design intuitive and accessible products. This empathetic approach is crucial in enhancing user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design.

teaching.title: Teaching and help others
teaching.text: I actively support others by sharing coding principles, explaining concepts, and helping in general. This help me create a great environment and also learn while teaching.

adaptability-feedback.title: Adaptability to Feedback
adaptability-feedback.text: I'm open to feedback from peers, clients, and users, seeing it as a chance to grow and improve. Being adaptable to constructive criticism helps me thrive in the ever-changing tech.

client.title: Client concerned
client.text: I prioritize understanding client needs and expectations, ensuring that my work aligns with their vision and objectives. By maintaining open communication and actively seeking feedback, I build strong relationships and deliver results that exceed client satisfaction.

nextJS.text: React's framework for web. Create high-quality web applications.

reacjs.text: JavaScript's library to create native and web user interfaces.

javascript.text: Easy to use and lightweight language. Used for a lot of things, including most of the web.

firebase.text: A Google Platform that offers a lot of services like databases, auth and much more.

tailwind.text: A CSS framework that uses utility classes as principles. Provides a very good design system too.

figma.text: A design platform use for most of web developers to create wireframes and layouts very easy.

wordpress.text: A web design platform use in a lot of institutional sites, blogs, stores and much more.

adobe-photoshop.text: A raster image graphics editor. Used for a lot of designers.

adobe-illustrator.text: A vector image graphics editor. Used for a lot of designers.

bootstrap.text: Frontend toolkit very opinated, but classic in web.

material-ui.text: A component library for React (But has for other languages too) which offers a lot of ready-to-use components
